p: As water resources become increasingly scarce, especially under climate change, securing food supplies will depend on increases in water use efficiency 28 29 30. Water use efficiency in maize systems can be increased by optimizing irrigation (e.g., by deficit irrigation) and by increasing soil water retention via conservation agriculture, minimum tillage, and the covering of the soil surface in the field (with crop residues or plastic) 28 30 31. Water-use efficiency can also be increased by rotations that include crops that are especially efficient in their use of water 32. Another important approach is to develop high-yielding, stress-tolerant maize varieties 1 33.
